channel.title: Nuclear weapons
channel.description:
What do think about them? I hate the fact that USA has too many of them, and ironic, they go to other countries because they have nuclear weapons...
In my opinion, world would be so much better place without nuclear weapons, because there is this chance: 1. Some country launches nuclear missile to an other country 2. The victim country launches their nukes to attacker country when they notice that there is nuke coming to their country. 3. Revenge circle.
I will laugh if something like that happens, humans destroying their world.

The Message was approved by President Bush :P[br][size=1]Posted on: March 30, 2007, 04:43:41 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Mopman, post:23, topic:67979”][quote author=lothy link=topic=99422.msg1040852#msg1040852 date=1174681082]

[/quote]

Hehe, you aren’t as in with America as you think.
They still spy on you, as you still spy on them. A nice, trusting relationship there.[/quote]
Ya, You other contries smile us in the face, while you stab us in the back, We love you too, France, Suadi Araba, and Russia
God bless America.
'Cause where not communist, yet.

item.title: Nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

A hydrogen bomb is a nuke.

You’ve got fission-based and fusion-based weapons. The former is what most people refer to as “atomic bomb”, and the latter is what most people probably mean when they say “nuke”, although both are nuclear bombs.

I probably got a bit of this wrong again, Krichovsky corrected me last time.

Read full topic

item.title: Nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:28, topic:67979”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=99422.msg1051691#msg1051691 date=1174870787]

Well, what bout teh ATOMIC BOMB

Nuclear bombs are bigger.

And so are hydrogen bombs.
[/quote]

I’m pretty sure it’s been explained already in this thread that “nuclear bomb”, “atomic bomb” and “hydrogen bomb” are all inaccurate names for various nuclear weapons. Essentially, they’re the same thing. A nuclear bomb cannot be bigger than an atomic bomb, because an atomic bomb is a nuclear bomb.

Or to put it another way: is a Cocker Spaniel bigger than a dog?[/quote]
Really? When people say normal “atomic” bombs they are generally talking about bombs the size of the one dropped on Hiroshima. Modern nukes are ~100x more powerful (new ones are 10 megatons or so. Old ones were around 85 kilotons (I think)).

And aren’t hydrogen bombs a slightly different technology than nukes?

Read full topic

item.title: Nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:27, topic:67979”][quote author=chipmunk man link=topic=99422.msg1047627#msg1047627 date=1174797431]
Well, what bout teh ATOMIC BOMB
[/quote]
Nuclear bombs are bigger.

And so are hydrogen bombs.[/quote]

I’m pretty sure it’s been explained already in this thread that “nuclear bomb”, “atomic bomb” and “hydrogen bomb” are all inaccurate names for various nuclear weapons. Essentially, they’re the same thing. A nuclear bomb cannot be bigger than an atomic bomb, because an atomic bomb is a nuclear bomb.

Or to put it another way: is a Cocker Spaniel bigger than a dog?

Read full topic

item.title: Nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: @pookey71 Pookey71
item.description:
@pookey71 wrote:

xxlegitxx:

What purpose did they serve in the Cold War?

No missile was ever fired.It was just like this
“Omfg i’ll send over a neculer bomb!!!”
Then the soviet union (I think it was them not to sure)where like
“We’ll send 2!!!ONe!!!Shift”
The Americans
“FINE WE’LL SEND 3 AND A V2”
It builded up but nothing happened.

To those people with Hiroshima facts ‘n’ stuff.The atomic war head used wasn’t very big…
Think of it like this…In Australia to power the nuculer facility for 100 years they needed like 3-10 (Not sure about exact number but it’s around there) pieces of uranium about the size of a stick of chalk.The V2’s (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V-2_rocket) was designed to carry a 1 tonne warhead (Atomic)Imagine that dropping on New York.Most of America would be dead.If not of the inital explosion but of the radiation poisoning.I might be wrong.So don’t use this information in essays ‘n’ stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: @jawakult jawakult
item.description:
@jawakult wrote:

Secet:

What do think about them? I hate the fact that USA has too many of them, and ironic, they go to other countries because they have nuclear weapons…

They served a purpose in the Cold War but these days they have less and less use. They cost a lot of money, if the nuke sites are attacked they could cause a lot of trouble, and at some point we are going to have to get rid of all that radioactive sludge.
On the other hand its better to have and not need than need and not have, so keeping them a bit longer seems a good plan.

Read full topic
